shell_commands.alias: Date and time {{date:YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss}} to file

platform_specific_commands.default:
echo "Date and time: "{{date:YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss}} >> TestResults.md
# 2023-03-25: This shell command is nowadays only used for testing variable parsing in Obsidian's command palette. It's not anymore executed in the typical testing process.

echo "File name: "{{file_name}} >> TestResults.md
# 2023-03-25: This shell command is nowadays only used for testing variable parsing in Obsidian's command palette. It's not anymore executed in the typical testing process.

# Copy test results to the end of the test report file.
cat TestResults.md >> "../Performed tests/"{{date:YYYY-MM-DD}}" (incomplete).md"

# Sleep one second to make sure TestResults.md is not emptied before it's written to the report file.
sleep 1

# Clear the test results file's content.
echo -n "" > TestResults.md

# Rename the test report file
cd "../Performed tests/"
mv {{date:YYYY-MM-DD}}" (incomplete).md" {{date:YYYY-MM-DD}}\ \({{_plugin_version}}\)\ {{_operating_system}}\ {{_test_status}}.md

# Sleep one second, otherwise the file opening may be tried before the file had time to rename.
sleep 1

# Open the renamed file in Obsidian (:-1 sets caret to the last line).
echo {{date:YYYY-MM-DD}}\ \({{_plugin_version}}\)\ {{_operating_system}}\ {{_test_status}}.md:-1
platform_specific_commands.win32:
# Copy test results to the end of the test report file.
type TestResults.md >> "..\Performed tests\{{date:YYYY-MM-DD}} (incomplete).md"

# Sleep one second to make sure TestResults.md is not emptied before it's written to the report file.
sleep 1

# Clear the test results file's content.
Write-Host -NoNewLine > TestResults.md

# Rename the test report file
cd "..\Performed tests\"
ren "{{date:YYYY-MM-DD}} (incomplete).md" "{{date:YYYY-MM-DD}} ({{_plugin_version}}) {{_operating_system}} {{_test_status}}.md"

# Sleep one second, otherwise the file opening may be tried before the file had time to rename.
sleep 1

# Open the renamed file in Obsidian (:-1 sets caret to the last line).
echo "{{date:YYYY-MM-DD}} ({{_plugin_version}}) {{_operating_system}} {{_test_status}}.md:-1"

platform_specific_commands.default: echo "Test non-ASCII characters: Ã… Ã„ Ã–" >> TestResults.md

shell_commands.alias: Test output to stderr, with exit code 0

platform_specific_commands.default: echo "Multiline output" && echo "hides earlier lines." && echo "Only the last line is permanently displayed on the status bar."

platform_specific_commands.win32: echo Windows shell should be CMD: %COMSPEC% >> TestResults.md

platform_specific_commands.linux: echo "Linux shell should be Bash: "$(readlink /proc/$$/exe) >> TestResults.md
platform_specific_commands.darwin: echo "macOS shell should be Bash: "$(readlink /proc/$$/exe) >> TestResults.md

platform_specific_commands.linux: echo "Linux shell should be Zsh: "$(readlink /proc/$$/exe) >> TestResults.md
platform_specific_commands.darwin: echo "macOS shell should be Zsh: "$(readlink /proc/$$/exe) >> TestResults.md

platform_specific_commands.default: echo "This should NOT be written to TestResults.md!!!" {{passthrough:>>}} TestResults.md

platform_specific_commands.linux: echo "Linux shell should be Dash: "$(readlink /proc/$$/exe) >> TestResults.md
platform_specific_commands.darwin: echo "macOS shell should be Dash: "$(readlink /proc/$$/exe) >> TestResults.md

echo "Builtin variable's global default value: {{event_title}}" >> TestResults.md
echo "Custom variable's global default value: {{_variable_with_default_value}}" >> TestResults.md

shell_commands.alias: Test file menu event variables (excluding event_file_content and event_note_content)

platform_specific_commands.win32:
# Use printf instead of echo, because echo works in PowerShell and CMD.EXE, but printf doesn't, so it's a good breaker to notice if this command is accidentally executed in PowerShell/CMD.EXE instead of WSL.
printf "Hello from WSL!\n" >> TestResults.md
printf "You wanted to output this: "{{_wsl_test_variable}}"\n" >> TestResults.md
printf "Variable escaping should use unix style escaping: "{{passthrough:+-*/}}"\n" >> TestResults.md

# Use printf instead of echo, because echo works in PowerShell and CMD.EXE, but printf doesn't, so it's a good breaker to notice if this command is accidentally executed in PowerShell/CMD.EXE instead of MinGW-w64.
printf "Hello from MinGW-w64!\n" >> TestResults.md
printf "Vault path: "{{vault_path}}"\n" >> TestResults.md
printf "Variable escaping should use unix style escaping: "{{passthrough:+-*/}}"\n" >> TestResults.md

platform_specific_commands.linux:
# Use echo. instead of normal echo, because echo works in Bash etc, but echo. doesn't, so it's a good breaker to notice if this command is accidentally executed in Bash instead of Wine+CMD.EXE.
echo. Hello from CMD.EXE via Wine! >> TestResults.md

prompts.title: Test prompt {{date:YYYY-MM-DD}}

fields.label: Mandatory field
fields.description: 1. Try to submit the prompt without filling this, ensure an error message is shown saying that this field must be filled. 2. Type value: example

fields.label: Field using variables
fields.description: Check that the value is the current year by default, and then add {{file_name}} to the end (using the file_name variable).

prompts.title: Finish test
prompts.description: {{file_name}} will be renamed according to the input you give here.

fields.label: Plugin version
fields.description: E.g. 0.5.0. If you are testing a version that is not yet published as a stable version, please add also a suffix describing the status, e.g. 0.7.0-beta1 (for public betas) or 0.7.0-development (for non-beta development versions, available only to me).

fields.label: Test status
fields.description: Type ok if all tests were successful, or FAILED if even just one test failed.

prompts.title: Begin test
prompts.description:
Note that this script overwrites contents of the following files:
 - Sandbox/TestResults.md: The content is emptied.
 - Performed tests/{{date:YYYY-MM-DD}} (incomplete).md: Possible earlier content is replaced with content from Assets/Templates/Test report.template.md.
prompts.execute_button_text: Create a new test report file

default_value.value: This is a global default value for {{event_title}}.

custom_variables.name: optional_field
custom_variables.description: This should become an empty string.

custom_variables.name: uri_custom_variable_1
custom_variables.description: Used in Shell commands URI testing.

custom_variables.name: uri_custom_variable_2
custom_variables.description: Used in Shell commands URI testing.

custom_variables.name: variable_with_default_value
custom_variables.description: This variable is never planned to be assigned an actual value. It should always fall back to a default value.

default_value.value: This is a global default value for a custom variable.

custom_shells.name: Windows Subsystem for Linux (WSL)
custom_shells.description:
"WSL is a feature of Windows that allows developers to run a Linux environment without the need for a separate virtual machine or dual booting." (from: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Windows_Subsystem_for_Linux)

This custom shell configuration allows you to execute Linux/Bash commands from Obsidian on Windows.

Install WSL: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/wsl/install

custom_shells.name: MinGW-w64
custom_shells.description:
"Mingw-w64 is an advancement of the original mingw.org project, created to support the GCC compiler on Windows systems." (from: https://www.mingw-w64.org/)

This custom shell configuration allows you to execute some Linux/Bash commands from Obsidian on Windows.

custom_shells.name: Wine + CMD.EXE
custom_shells.shell_command_test: echo Current working directory: & cd & echo Vault path: {{vault_path}}
